cleaned_text: Acupuncture is a great option for pain management. It can help to reduce pain and inflammation, without the side effects as traditional pain medications. Acupuncture is a popular form of stress management. It involves inserting thin needles into specific points on the body to relieve tension and stress. Acupuncture involves inserting thin needles into the skin at specific points on the body. Research suggests that acupuncture can help treat many autoimmune conditions. Acupuncture is a traditional Chinese medicine that inserts needles into specific points on the body to relieve pain and treat a variety of physical ailments. Cupping therapy is said to help improve circulation and remove toxins from the body. David Schnitzer is a licensed Acupuncturist Physician and a diplomate of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine by the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine. Since leaving the military in 1992, David has been on a journey to help people relive their suffering and promote a healthy lifestyle. David earned his B.S. in Psychology from the University of Central Florida and a Master's Degree in Oriental Medicine from the Southeast College of Oriental Medicine, where he received the "Clinical Excellence" award given to the college's highest achieving student. He trained under Dr. Gordon Xu, a Master in Oriental Medicine. David has been in private practice for over 18 years. He is contracted to do acupuncture at the Hanley Center. Casey McCaig is a licensed Acupuncture Physician and a Diplomate of Oriental Medicine by the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine. She is trained in Traditional Chinese Medicine, Japanese Acupuncture, Orthopedic Acupuncture, and Chinese Herbology. It is her specialization in the gentle style of Japanese acupuncture that fuels her passion for treating women's health, cosmetic acupuncture, stress, anxiety, and pain management. Casey received her B.A. in Humanities at the University of Central Florida and her Master of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine at the New England School of Acupuncture. She received her 200hour Yoga Teacher Training in the Bahamas, where she took a deep dive into exploring the world of meditation and a balanced lifestyle. This background is the foundation for her diversified ability to offer patients a caring, supportive, and knowledgeable approach to achieve their goals.
